Hi,

It sounds like what you need is a framework called Cactus
(http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus).  It extends JUnit to run in a web/app
container.  It is well documented.  Enjoy!

-Larry

-----Original Message-----
From: boothana [mailto:boothana@...]
Sent: Tuesday, September 09, 2003 8:53 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Running tests using an application server


I currently use a JBoss web server, and the barracuda framework. I 
need to run my unit tests. what I am looking at accomplishing with 
these unit tests is that I should be able to get data from the 
database, and use the retrieved data in the unit tests. 

I am able to accomplish this using JBuilder IDE, but I would like to 
run my tests from the command line. When I use the 
junit.swingui.TestRunner class, it runs fine as long what I am 
testing is tn the current jvm, but the database operations happen, 
through JBoss and this part of my test is failing.

Would some body please help.

subject: RE: [junit] Running tests using an application server
